content:
Diagnosis:	Vulvar basal cell carcinoma

Management:	15 Jan 2024 Wide local excision with bilateral inguinal node sampling
		12 Feb 2024 Started adjuvant radiotherapy

Histology:	pT1N0M0 basal cell carcinoma with clear margins (>5mm). 0/6 right and 0/5 left inguinal nodes involved.

Current Situation:	Week 4 of adjuvant radiotherapy

I reviewed [redacted name] today during her radiotherapy treatment course. She is managing relatively well overall but experiencing increasing local symptoms. The main issues are grade 2 radiation dermatitis affecting the vulvar and bilateral groin regions, requiring regular analgesia and careful skin care. She describes moderate pain and discomfort, particularly towards the end of each day, which is partially controlled with regular paracetamol and occasional tramadol. Despite these challenges, she remains motivated to complete the full course of treatment.

On examination today, there is confluent erythema with patchy moist desquamation of the vulvar region and bilateral groins, consistent with expected radiation changes at this stage. No evidence of infection. The surgical sites remain well-healed with no concerning features.

Her performance status remains 1, though she is finding daily activities more challenging due to local discomfort. She continues to maintain good oral intake and stable weight. Blood tests today show stable renal function and no concerning features.

The plan is to continue with radiotherapy as scheduled. I have prescribed additional analgesic medications and arranged for our specialist radiotherapy nurse to review her skin care regime. She will be reviewed again next week, and we have given clear instructions about contacting the team if symptoms worsen. A follow-up appointment will be arranged for 6 weeks after completion of radiotherapy.
